channel.title: PI character looks glitch
channel.description:
Lots of people on my server have fucked up character looks and none of them know how they got it. They logged out and came back and they were 'nulled'. Their character looks were negative and high.
Example of a regular player's looks: [code] [LOOK] character-look = 0 0 character-look = 1 0 character-look = 2 18 character-look = 3 26 character-look = 4 33 character-look = 5 36 character-look = 6 42 character-look = 7 10 character-look = 8 0 character-look = 9 0 character-look = 10 0 character-look = 11 0 character-look = 12 0 [/code]
Example of a 'nulled' player's looks: [code] [LOOK] character-look = 0 2 character-look = 1 -108 character-look = 2 1 character-look = 3 126 character-look = 4 2 character-look = 5 -108 character-look = 6 -86 character-look = 7 78 character-look = 8 26 character-look = 9 37 character-look = 10 4 character-look = 11 53 character-look = 12 -112[/code]
What this glitch does is freeze anybody in this player's log in radius... Which is a big problem.

item.title: PI character looks glitch
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

imsuperman05:

I had this before, but it was because of some nulled items that I used. Does this happen often?

Happens about 4 times a month, possibly more. I don’t monitor how many times it happens per month D:

sex-scape owner:

you could make the look reset to 0 on everything on logout

Why? Don’t you want to have your own unique look? Don’t you want to continue making fun of that shemale? :L

Read full topic

item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Neither of you told me what’s actually wrong with it - why it does this. It does not fuck with anything else in the player’s character file, only the looks for some reason. I know PI is unstable. Stop talking about the stability, stay on topic.

item.title: PI character looks glitch
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Camballer:

PI is unstable.

Way to point out the obvious.

Check all references to the variables for the player’s looks (z-filesearcher or IDE) and you can see what is changing them. I doubt its a problem with the player saving.

Read full topic

item.title: PI character looks glitch
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[code=java]package server.model.players;

import java.util.ArrayList;

import server.Server;

/**

  • @author Sanity
    */

public class PlayerSaving implements Runnable {

private ArrayList<Integer> requests = new ArrayList<Integer>();
private Thread thread;
private static PlayerSaving singleton;
private static long lastGroupSave;
private static final int SAVE_TIMER = 15000; //every 15 seconds instead of 300 seconds. obviously prevents rollbacks.

public static PlayerSaving getSingleton() {
	return singleton;
}

public static void initialize() {
	singleton = new PlayerSaving();
	singleton.thread = new Thread(singleton);
	singleton.thread.start();
}

public synchronized void run() {
	while(true) {
		saveAllPlayers();
		try {
			thread.sleep(300000);
		} catch (Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}	
}

public synchronized void requestSave(int i) {
	if (!requests.contains(i)) {
		requests.add(i);
		notify();
	}
}

public void saveAllPlayers() {
	lastGroupSave = System.currentTimeMillis();
	//requests.clear();
	long start = lastGroupSave;
	for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
		if (p != null)
			PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)p);
		if (System.currentTimeMillis() - start >= (Server.getSleepTimer() - 5)) {
			System.out.println("Aborted all saving to prevent lag.");
			return;
		}	
	}
	System.out.println("Saved all games.");
}

public void saveRequests() {
	int totalSave = 0;
	for (int id : requests) {
		if (PlayerHandler.players[id] != null) {
			Client c = (Client)PlayerHandler.players[id];
			PlayerSave.saveGame((Client)PlayerHandler.players[id]);
			totalSave++;
		}		
	}
	System.out.println("Saved a total of: " + totalSave + " games.");
	requests.clear();
}

public static boolean saveRequired() {
	return System.currentTimeMillis() - lastGroupSave > SAVE_TIMER;
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: PI character looks glitch
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

Fridder:

Not sure. I was thinking of some type of a code that checks to see if that player has looks that look like that when they log in, and if they do, they automatically get teleported to some random black spot on the map like 322 300 and it also resets their looks and pops up the ‘change your looks’ interface.

Well yeah. you could make that the character look saves by clicking on the log out button, and by logging in it checks if the character look is same as it was when the player logged out
